author: dimitri777
title: Onboard Freelancers to any projects
description: We cannot afford to hire full time staff but must rely on freelancers to fulfill the various roles of our social and charitable projects

f6_assessments.q0: This project is a small aspect of a large project. It creates a real time system which enables freelancers or volunteers to pick up a shift and also to swap shifts when they need to. When payment is due, their working hours would be easily identifiable as well as the roles they have played during those hours. This creates transparency in payments of salaries, wages and payments and can be replicated in any business involving full time staff, freelancers or volunteers. More broadly, this project also brings benefits to many stakeholders. Help improve the meals of the disadvantaged, protect the environment, cut CO2, help add value to Cardano. It is for the above reasons that I believe this project has effectively tackled the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Team information has been provided. They are a strong team, they have all the knowledge, experience and skills to carry out the project. Links to LinkedIn profiles are also provided. This makes the information more transparent. However, the main purpose of this proposal is to build an NFT, so it would be great if you provided information about the people who would do the work. This is very necessary, at the moment I can't find any information about who will build the NFT.
A detailed roadmap has been provided, specific tasks and timelines are listed. However, that seems like a common route for the whole big project. This proposal is only one aspect, so I think you should define a route that focuses on the problem of building NFTs. As for the budget allocation, it needs further clarification. How long will the social media and promotion take place? How many people will be involved in the work? How long will the documentary video be? It is also necessary to have specific metrics to evaluate the progress and success of the project. This will make it easier for PAs to track and evaluate. I have a few suggestions for you: the number of shift swaps is 500 per month, there are 1000 NFTs sold on the CNFT market every month,...
f6_assessments.q2: I understand, this is a small aspect of a big project. Therefore, you must clarify it, making it separate from other aspects. That will make the community recognize and add confidence in the project. The information provided is not really complete, but I have learned about your big project and I believe this proposal will be successfully implemented. It brings a huge impact to the community, especially promoting the growth of the Cardano ecosystem. In the future, if successfully implemented, I hope you will handle the risks and challenges that you will encounter as what you have provided. Thank you, if there is a chance I will definitely participate in your project, I am a person who is very interested in volunteer work.
f6_assessments.reply:
This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.

Yes you are more than welcome to come and volunteer with us

f6_assessments.q0: This is a very promising proposal in my opinion. The solution addresses the problem greatly and I can see how it’s aligned with our challenge. The proposers have delivered their idea very thoroughly. In my opinion, this proposal will bring a huge impact in the real world as it promises to give work to people who are in need, solve food waste problems and on a bigger scale – the increasing CO2 emission problems. Technologies will be applied appropriately to help with arranging schedules and payments. The proposers have gone way beyond to show us how the project is going to benefit every party, from the stakeholders, and blockchain community to every individual and family. This project carries a lot of humanity and I think it’ll also help to somehow change the negative idea about blockchain by its potential great impact. With that being said, the project will add so much value to the Cardano ecosystem and can be a leading model for any other project of its kind. With such a detailed description from the team, we can easily how this project is going to run as a completed product. The team has a detailed vision of their work in progress, every aspect and step is being considered. A pool of key metrics is available for anyone who wants to measure the process and those key metrics are very specific and fully support the project’s scope. The communication is already ongoing and there’re certain interests from every party, that land a solid foundation for the project when it is launched. Not only have a short-term plan, but the team also commits itself to address future challenges in a long run, and I think it’s a valuable point for us to count on the potential of the fund being spent. I’m also very impressed that the team has considered a completed scene of risks. Not only pointing out the risks, but they also show how they don’t underestimate any risks from the pandemic, volatility of ADA to the misuse of the system and have serious solutions for all of them.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does an amazing job in describing the impact of its solution. This project provides a management system that controls the freelancers for various purposes. In this proposal, the purpose is to deliver leftovers to those in need. First of all, the proposal deceives the problem thoroughly and points out the necessity of the management system. By taking advantage of NFTs, the project will classify freelancers into different roles with a specific working time so that later, freelancers can trade their shift and role without any third-party interference. As can be seen, this is a meaningful project that not only help the social community but also the Cardano community itself. These benefits are specifically described in the proposal which targeted directly to each group of users: Stakeholders, Blockchain community, Stake Pool Operator, etc. in short, “This project will have a positive impact on the Cardano system because it will enable any business to effectively manage their freelancers and volunteers in a cost effective manner, with minimal or no disruption to the schedule”. Another notable thing is they also bring up several key metrics to measure the project impact such as Number of food packs distributed per day, Number of NFTs handled of each role by freelancers or volunteers. Lastly, the risks of the project are also described specifically. Those associated with increased fuel price, Volatility of ADA ,etc. However, the proposal has successfully mitigated these obstacles with a reasonable solution.
f6_assessments.q1: The project plan is clear. Since this is the developing phrase, most of the work is focused on contacting the relevant partners and completing the NFT solution. Moreover, they also list a series of KPIs to measure the development. However, they should include a specific timeline for each period to track the progress more easily. As for the budget, it is also thoroughly distributed. Most of it are salaries of the staff. With reference for the member list, it is completely detailed. Each member is provided with an overview and a linked in profile or Facebook address for further contact.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal offers a pool of key metrics to track the project progress. These key metrics will be published for the community via the app or the system. More interestingly, they even invite people, if have a chance, pay a visit and watch their work directly. Their vision of success is the increase in productivity and become the successful model for other NGOs, Volunteer driven organizations, Charities and businesses.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.

f6_assessments.q0: I sincerely hope the proposal is funded as it is a very noble idea and it will help to develop the Cardano ecosystem with new humanitarian use cases; and we know how one of the most holistic goals of the Cardano project is to make the world a better place. A system would be created to establish transparency among the members of a work team; they would be freelancers and their work hours, roles, shifts and pay would all be available and traceable through the blockchain on that platform. The general objective is to combat food waste as well, the proponent explains how some food is wasted in certain countries and people's work could allow them to eat food that goes beyond the basic received (rice, lentils etc). In my view, the proposal has a lot to do with Cardano when it proposes to create a dApp that records data on the blockchain, and it can be a way to bring together new members in the community who are not necessarily interested in the cryptographic world, but in the service.
f6_assessments.q1: The first month of work is extremely detailed, the degree of specificity drops a little as the months go by, but in view the roadmap is still very, very informative and allows us to have a proper understanding of the development process. The division of expenses, on the other hand, sins a little in this sense. Split values are not well explained. What would the contingency fee be and why would it cost $3,000? The presentation of the professionals involved is extremely satisfactory, we know a lot about each one and we even see how there are people extremely connected with Cardano here – conveying very good confidence in their abilities to carry out the project successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Numerical data, such as “Number of food packages collected per restaurant per day. Can be tracked by NFTs generated from that unique restaurant ID per specific day” are provided. Not enough, some qualitative data are also described that allow a careful and constant analysis of progress. Success is defined very richly in detail, there are several objectives, such as “Ability to increase our beneficiary locations Ability to increase our donor base of individuals and companies that come to us to donate their surplus food for parties and events”. My question is, how to make this scenario of success more palpable for the Cardano community? Due to the nature of the proposal, my suggestion is that further research be carried out, which can demonstrate the impacts, and that this becomes more known to all of us.

solution: A system where  project can establish transparency of team members doing various roles join on a shift basis and be paid for the shifts.
experience: I've managed social projects over 36 years, Have been on planning committees and packing teams for distributing dry rations for various natural disasters and in the 2004 tsunami as well as recent lockdowns. I got a pass to carry out distribution of food during lockdown
